references: To reduce the communication overhead, [14, 15, 16, 17] incorporate the quantization, sparsification and error compensation schemes. However, these works do not consider the energy consumption and communication errors. Another line of works [18, 19, 20] adopt the over-the-air computation scheme for model updates aggregation to improve the communication efficiency. [21, 22, 23] further combine model updates compression schemes with over-the-air aggregation. While over-the-air computation mechanisms demonstrate advantages in terms of bandwidth efficiency, they usually require tight synchronization and CSI information at the workers side for power equalization. Besides, none of these works consider the energy consumption of the workers. A summary of the main differences between this work and the current state of the art can be found in Table I.

references: Table II and Table III show the testing accuracy and energy consumption of SignSGD with the proposed operation point and FedAVG with the optimal Tlsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘™T_{l}. It can be observed that SignSGD outperforms FedAVG in both testing accuracy and energy consumption. For SignSGD and FedAVG, we set the total training time Ttâ€‹oâ€‹tâ€‹aâ€‹l=300subscriptğ‘‡ğ‘¡ğ‘œğ‘¡ğ‘ğ‘™300T_{total}=300s, while for Algorithm 2, we present the results with a total training time of Ttâ€‹oâ€‹tâ€‹aâ€‹l=250subscriptğ‘‡ğ‘¡ğ‘œğ‘¡ğ‘ğ‘™250T_{total}=250s. In addition to the pre-determined CPU frequency cases where the workers obtain their gradients before computing their outage probabilities, we also examined the scenario where each worker optimizes the CPU frequency given a pre-determined outage probability requirement poâ€‹uâ€‹t,m=0.1subscriptğ‘ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘¡ğ‘š0.1p_{out,m}=0.1 for Algorithm 2 with fmâ€‹iâ€‹n,m=0.2subscriptğ‘“ğ‘šğ‘–ğ‘›ğ‘š0.2f_{min,m}=0.2 GHz and fmâ€‹aâ€‹x,m=3subscriptğ‘“ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘š3f_{max,m}=3 GHz. For FedAVG with optimal Tlsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘™T_{l}, we note that the outage probabilities of the workers are larger than 0.1 for all the examined CPU frequencies. It can be observed from Table IV and Table V that Algorithm 2 outperforms FedAVG and SignSGD in both testing accuracy and energy consumption given a shorter training time. That being said, Algorithm 2 improves the learning performance and reduces the energy consumption simultaneously, which demonstrates its effectiveness. references:
We also examine the impact of data heterogeneity (i.e., Î±ğ›¼\alpha) in the Dirichlet distribution scheme. Table VI and Table VII compare the testing accuracy and the energy consumption of the learning algorithms, respectively, given fm=2subscriptğ‘“ğ‘š2f_{m}=2 GHz for all the workers. It can be observed that the performance of SignSGD and FedAVG improves as Î±ğ›¼\alpha
increases, which corresponds to more homogeneous data distribution. Meanwhile, Algorithm 2 outperforms SignSGD and FedAVG in both testing accuracy and energy consumption in all the examined scenarios, which demonstrates its effectiveness in the presence of different levels of data heterogeneity. Moreover, it is worth mentioning that the optimal Tlsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘™T_{l} and number of local iterations for FedAvg are different given different Î±ğ›¼\alpha, which leads to different energy consumption.

references: For the homogeneous data distribution scenario, given the theoretically derived outage probability poâ€‹uâ€‹tâ€‹(rm)subscriptğ‘ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘šp_{out}(r_{m}), we assume that the actual outage probability is uniformly distributed in the interval [poâ€‹uâ€‹tâ€‹(rm),poâ€‹uâ€‹tâ€‹(rm)Ã—(1+Î”)]subscriptğ‘ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘œğ‘¢ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘š1Î”[p_{out}(r_{m}),p_{out}(r_{m})\times(1+\Delta)]. That being said, the channel conditions are worse than the ones that each worker uses for parameter configuration. We note that this is conservative since the performance of the learning algorithms is supposed to improve as the probability of outage decreases. Table VIII shows the testing accuracy of SignSGD with the configurations given by the solution of (17). The other parameters are the same as those in Section VII-A. It can be observed that the SignSGD with Î”âˆˆ{10%,30%,50%}Î”percent10percent30percent50\Delta\in\{10\%,30\%,50\%\} achieves comparable performance in testing accuracy to the Î”=0Î”0\Delta=0 case. We note that, according to (19), the energy consumption is independent of Î”Î”\Delta. Therefore, the energy consumption remains the same for different Î”Î”\Delta.
